meanings.definition: The quality or state of being strong and healthy.
meanings.sent1: His robustness allowed him to recover quickly from the flu.
meanings.sent2: The tree's robustness helped it withstand the strong winds.
meanings.sent3: Despite his small size, the puppy's robustness made him the leader of the pack.
meanings.sent4: The robustness of the old bridge was tested by the heavy traffic every day.
meanings.sent5: The robustness of the castle walls protected the kingdom from invaders.

meanings.definition: The ability to withstand or overcome adverse conditions.
meanings.sent1: The robustness of the shelter kept the family safe during the storm.
meanings.sent2: Farmers rely on the robustness of their crops to survive harsh weather.
meanings.sent3: The hiker's robustness was put to the test during the challenging mountain climb.
meanings.sent4: Her mental robustness helped her overcome the difficult situation at work.
meanings.sent5: The robustness of the ship's hull ensured it could navigate rough seas.

meanings.definition: The quality of being full-bodied and rich in flavor.
meanings.sent1: The robustness of the coffee made it a favorite among caffeine lovers.
meanings.sent2: The chef's secret ingredient added robustness to the stew.
meanings.sent3: The robustness of the chocolate cake delighted everyone at the party.
meanings.sent4: The wine connoisseur appreciated the robustness of the red wine.
meanings.sent5: The robustness of the spices gave the curry a flavorful kick.
